explanation: The loop used range(n-1) which incorrectly assumes each input list a has length n. This can cause wrong indexing or missed pairs when a has a different length. I changed that line to iterate over the actual length of a (len(a)-1), so we process consecutive pairs from the input list correctly.
fixed_code:
n,m = map(int,input().split())
huneka = [[1] * n for _ in range(n)]
for _ in range(m):
    a = list(map(int,input().split()))
    for i in range (len(a)-1):
        x,y = a[i],a[i+1]
        hunaka[x-1][y-1]=0
        hunaka[y-1][x-1]=0
ans = sum(sum(row) for row in hunaka) - n
print(ans/2)
